cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 89 (Wednesday, May 22, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. WALTZ:H.R. 8515.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I Section 8The single subject of this legislation is:This bill enhances the U.S. maritime workforce andindustry.[Page H3485]

item.name: Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee
Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

Referred to the Committee on Armed Services, and in addition to the Committees on Science, Space, and Technology, and Transportation and Infrastructure, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.title: Maritime Advantage Results In National Economic Resiliency and Security Act

item.title: Maritime Advantage Results In National Economic Resiliency and Security Act
Maritime Advantage Results In National Economic Resiliency and Security Act
To promote and recruit the United States maritime industry workforce, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
